intro: Desmos cambodicus, commonly known as the Cambodian desmos, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenia. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
